verses.verse: (Book II) ((230 42-72)) (Longing for God and His Help in Distress) To the leader. A Maskil of the Korahites. (Ps 119.131) As a deer longs for flowing streams, so my soul longs for you, O God.
(Ps 43.4; 63.1; Jer 10.10) My soul thirsts for God, for the living God. When shall I come and behold the face of God?
(Ps 79.10; 80.5) My tears have been my food day and night, while people say to me continually, “Where is your God?”

(Ps 62.8; 100.4; Isa 30.29) These things I remember, as I pour out my soul: how I went with the throng (Meaning of Heb uncertain) and led them in procession to the house of God, with glad shouts and songs of thanksgiving, a multitude keeping festival.
(Ps 38.6; 44.3; 77.3; Lam 3.24) Why are you cast down, O my soul, and why are you disquieted within me? Hope in God, for I shall again praise him, my help
and my God. My soul is cast down within me; therefore I remember you from the land of Jordan and of Hermon, from Mount Mizar.
(Ps 88.7; Jon 2.3) Deep calls to deep at the thunder of your torrents; all your waves and your billows have gone over me.
(Job 35.10; Ps 57.3; 63.6; 149.5) By day the LORD commands his steadfast love, and at night his song is with me, a prayer to the God of my life.
(Ps 38.6) I say to God, my rock, “Why have you forgotten me? Why must I walk about mournfully because the enemy oppresses me?”
(v 3) As with a deadly wound in my body, my adversaries taunt me, while they say to me continually, “Where is your God?”
(v 5) Why are you cast down, O my soul, and why are you disquieted within me? Hope in God, for I shall again praise him, my help and my God.
